requirements.shall: All serviceable joints shall be metal-gasket face-seal (/FS, VCR-compatible) with no PTFE/elastomer in wetted helium service.
Each /FS remake shall use a new metal gasket with batch traceability and tamper evidence recorded.
Panel-side interfaces shall be female and module-side interfaces male; deviations shall be tagged and logged.
Pneumatic/solenoid pilots for manual isolation shall fail open so loss of air does not obstruct nominal flow.
Leak acceptance shall meet Addendum Table 6 limits under ambient and standby conditions using EN 13185 / ISO 20485 methods.
DBB plus eductor purge shall achieve residual air ≤0.05 % before breaking /FS joints and shall log helium loss per cycle.
QINFRA.S and QRB.S headers shall be protected at 1.3 bar(a) with PSV capacity ≥200 g/s helium at 300 K discharged to WCS.LP recovery.
Provide bursting disc and PSV populations and setpoints as specified (BD 60 QCELL + 5 QPLANT; PSV 180 QCELL + 30 QPLANT with stated setpoints) and certify orifice capacities.
Implement tamper-evident ties across /FS nuts with scan-based remake counts integrated to the maintenance system.
Install dual helium analyzers (GAP.WCS and GAP.QRB) measuring H₂O and N₂ with ±1 ppm accuracy and ≤±1 ppm/year drift; maintain calibration certificates.
